summary: This document is an email chain from December 2018 discussing a meeting to discuss the Epstein case, specifically referencing lawmakers calling on the DOJ to explain the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) given to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate a call time and suggest using an office with a good speakerphone.

persons.name: Lisa Zornberg
persons.context: Appears as the sender of an email in the chain, suggesting a meeting in her office because her speakerphone is good. Her email signature indicates she is with USANYS (likely the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain and the news article referenced. Lawmakers are calling for an investigation into the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) he received.

events.title: Coordination of Meeting on Epstein NPA
events.description: Email chain among individuals, including Lisa Zornberg, to schedule a call/meeting to discuss the fallout from lawmakers demanding the DOJ explain the Non-Prosecution Agreement given to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Lawmakers Demand Probe into Epstein NPA
events.description: Various lawmakers call on the Department of Justice to explain the 'sweetheart deal' Non-Prosecution Agreement given to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as reported by NBC News.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated December 6-7, 2018, showing ongoing discussions about the Epstein case years after the original NPA.
It references a specific NBC News article detailing lawmakers' demands for a probe into Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement.
Lisa Zornberg, an attorney with USANYS, is involved in coordinating a discussion about the matter.
The correspondence indicates official attention and concern regarding the Epstein NPA within legal circles at that time.
